availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William E. Rice (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and captain, 10th KY Cav USA)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John Rice and Julia A. Rice. Student in Bath County in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from September 9, 1862, to September 16, 1863.
